channel.title: Make windows look like Ubuntu
channel.description:
A different theme patcher is needed for this to work on VISTA, this tutorial is for windows XP
[center][img]http://img237.imageshack.us/img237/7693/ubuntuaq9.png[/img][/center]
[b][size=15pt]Download everything you need for the tutorial[url=http://www.megaupload.com/?d=OIF461RW] HERE![/url][/size][/b]
This tutorial does not require any major installations, just make your windows look and feel like linux without having to use those risky os editors or anything like that :P
[b]NOTE:[/b] your dont need windowsblinds or any other type of 3rd party software for this its just to make it look somewhat like linux
[center][size=15pt]Installing the theme.[/size][/center]
Before you can use any themes, you must add a patch to windows that allows unassigned themes to be used. Download the [url=http://uppit.com/NPDMJ1]theme patcher[/url].
When you start the program, click 'patch', keep going until you get to the part where it asks you to insert your windows boot CD. Cancel at this time, by now, your theme should be windows classic. Next go to C:\WINDOWS\resources\themes and just leave that open.
Here are 2 decent themes for your linux look
Clearlooks - http://www.deviantart.com/deviation/18591720/ Ubuntu - http://uppit.com/9G6F6J Or if you downloaded the pack already, 'Ubuntu' is in there.
once downloaded, extract the folder to C:\WINDOWS\resources\Themes.
restart your computer then move on.
[center][size=15pt]Perfecting your theme.[/size][/center]
Ok, so now you restarted? Good. Now right click on your desktop and click properties, then go to the appearance tab and wala! your theme should be listed under there.
Now alot of other things may still look windows-ish, so if you would like, you can make [url=https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/1565/]firefox look a bit more like linux[/url].
Now for the icons, http://vertigosity.deviantart.com/art/Tango-Patcher-2600-7-08-2-27940418, this is also in the pack at the beginning of the tutorial, and is really the best i can find for right now.
when your installing the icons, the first set is blue, second is orange, 3rd is industrial 4th is gnome, when your installing the picture on the installer left side is them in order.
Install the icon patcher and you will have linux looking icons.
[center][size=15pt]We're almost done![/size][/center]
Now all you really need is the background
I have a decent amount attached, enjoy!
Here is my desktop after my transformation, I cant decide what color to get :P [img]http://img291.imageshack.us/img291/9720/mydesktoply0.png[/img]
[img]http://img265.imageshack.us/img265/6575/mydesk2oo4.png[/img]

item.title: Make windows look like Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

Your router isn’t compatible…? Or your don’t have the driver for your wireless card installed?

Do you have a crossover cable or something you can try and hook your comp directly to the router…

Then you can install ndiswrapper and get the driver for your wireless card.

Read full topic

item.title: Make windows look like Ubuntu

item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:25, topic:193402”][quote author=cooper link=topic=257417.msg2187513#msg2187513 date=1208232138]

My router isnt compatible with KDE or Ubuntu. As we discussed before, this is for people who dont want to risk that.

Sorry, I didn’t see the part about KDE… what router do you have?
[/quote]
Linksys wrt54gs[/quote]
http://whirlpool.net.au/index.cfm?a=h_view&model_id=363 says there are linux drivers.

Read full topic

So it’s the patcher not working. I’ll sort it tomorrow. I know what I was doing So don’t say “Blah Blah Blah”
Night.
[/quote]

You need Service Pack 2 for any UXTheme patcher to work[/quote]

Got it

item.title: Make windows look like Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:10, topic:193402”][quote author=bootnecklad link=topic=257417.msg2141702#msg2141702 date=1206743715]
I have a problem, Everything is ok except the theme, I extracted everything put it all in the right places then ran the patcher I rebooted and it’s not showing up as a theme, So now I’ve got Windows classic with icons as Ubuntu, It’s pretty cool actually.

EDIT - I’m re-doing everything now. Just waiting for the package to download.
[/quote]
All you do is put the FOLDER with the stuff in it in Themes. Dont take the stuff out of the folder and put it in there.[/quote]

I don’t have that problem it’s the patcher not working…

Heres what I did:

Downloaded The big package.

Extracted it

Extracted ‘Ubuntu.rar’ to ‘C:\WINDOWS\Resources\Theme’

Ran ‘Super tubo tango patcher.exe’

Rebooted

Ran ‘UXTheme Multi-Patcher (Neowin Edition) 4.0.exe’ (Came up with an error. It’s my pc)

So it’s the patcher not working. I’ll sort it tomorrow. I know what I was doing So don’t say “Blah Blah Blah”
Night.

Read full topic
